low.question: What is a time zone primarily based on?
What does UTC stand for in timekeeping?
Which country spans the most time zones including overseas territories?
If it is noon UTC, what time is it at UTC+3?
What event causes clocks to move forward one hour in many regions?
Which line is the basis for the date change when crossing oceans?
What is the Prime Meridian's longitude?
Which continent uses the fewest time zones across its mainland?
If New York is UTC-5 during standard time, what is its offset during standard time?
Which city defines GMT historically?
How many hours ahead is Tokyo (UTC+9) from London (UTC+0)?
What happens to the calendar when you cross the International Date Line traveling westward?
Which U.S. state has two time zones on the mainland?
Which global time standard replaced GMT in technical contexts?
Why do some countries use half-hour or 45-minute offsets?
Which hemisphere experiences longer daylight hours in June?
What is a common reason countries adjust their time zones historically?
Which U.S. time zone is two hours ahead of Pacific Time?
Which island nation is known for being the first to experience each new day?
What is the main practical purpose of the International Date Line?
options: To maintain consistent calendar dates across longitudes
To separate time zones by language
low.answer: To maintain consistent calendar dates across longitudes

low.question: Which term describes adjusting clocks backward one hour at the end of DST?
What does 'UTC+0' indicate about a place's time offset?
options: It is one hour ahead of UTC
It is one hour behind UTC

low.question: Which large country uses a single time zone despite spanning many longitudes?
If it is 6 PM in Los Angeles (UTC-8 standard), what time is it in New York (UTC-5 standard)?
What seasonal practice do many countries near mid-latitudes follow to save energy?
What is the typical length of one time zone in degrees of longitude?
Which ocean commonly determines reference when crossing the International Date Line?
Which country changed its standard time to reduce confusion with neighboring regions?
Which of these is a half-hour time offset country?
What is the term for the official legal time used by a country?

medium.question: Which treaty established the prime meridian at Greenwich in 1884?
Which U.S. state observes Atlantic Standard Time for most of the year?
What rare adjustment adds a second to UTC to align atomic clocks with Earth's rotation?
Which European country stopped observing Daylight Saving Time in 1975 but later resumed?
Which African country uses UTC+3 as standard time year-round?
Which U.S. territories permanently use Atlantic Time year-round?
options: Puerto Rico and US Virgin Islands
medium.answer: Puerto Rico and US Virgin Islands

medium.question: Which city is just west of the prime meridian but uses UTC+0 time legally?
Which country adopted a single time zone (UTC+8) in 1949 to unify administration?
Which island country set its time zone forward by 24 hours in 1995 to align with trading partners?
Which body is responsible for publishing and maintaining official time standards like UTC?
options: International Bureau of Weights and Measures (BIPM)
medium.answer: International Bureau of Weights and Measures (BIPM)

medium.question: Which city historically used 'local mean time' before adopting standardized zones?
Which U.S. law standardized time zones in the country in 1918?
Which country uses UTC+5:30 as its national time?
Which region observes the world's easternmost time zone at UTC+14?
Which practice do some countries use instead of DST to adjust local time seasonally?
Which European country spans three time zones including overseas regions?
Which island territory uses UTC-11, making it among the last places to see each day?
Which clock comparison revealed the need for global time standardization in the 19th century?
Which country uses two standard time zones despite its small land area due to political reasons?
What major change did Russia implement in 2011 related to clocks?
options: Abolished seasonal clock changes (stayed on DST)
Shifted all regions one hour earlier
medium.answer: Abolished seasonal clock changes (stayed on DST)

medium.question: Which organization coordinates leap second decisions?
options: International Earth Rotation and Reference Systems Service (IERS)
medium.answer: International Earth Rotation and Reference Systems Service (IERS)

medium.question: Which U.S. legislation limited the length of daylight saving time after 1966?
Which Latin American country uses UTC-4:30 as its standard time historically?
Which region uses 'Zulu time' as a synonym for UTC in aviation and military contexts?
Which factor often determines whether a country keeps DST: latitude, population size, or elevation?
Which famous meridian passing through Paris was replaced in international use by Greenwich?
Which U.S. state moved its time zone border in 2007 to better align with trade patterns?
Which country uses UTC+4:30 as its official time?
Which Pacific nation jumped the International Date Line in 2011 to align with Australia and New Zealand?
Which phenomenon requires inserting a negative leap second only in hypothetical scenarios, never yet used?
options: Earth rotating faster than atomic time
medium.answer: Earth rotating faster than atomic time

hard.question: Which country experimented with 'double daylight saving' creating two-hour seasonal shifts in the 1940s?
Which island group's repositioning of the International Date Line in 1995 created the world's earliest time zone?
Which mathematician's work underpins timekeeping and the definition of the second via atomic transitions?
Which year saw the first international agreement to adopt a single prime meridian at Greenwich?
Which country maintained two simultaneous time zones (legal vs. de facto) for decades for political reasons?
Which rare timekeeping oddity exists in Nepal's standard time offset?
Which Pacific nation uses a 45-minute offset (UTC-3:30) for part of its territory?
Which major railway company's timetabling problems in the 19th century led directly to time zone adoption?
Which treaty or conference first proposed an International Date Line concept in formal terms?
Which nation adopted 'Moscow Time' year-round in 2014 by changing DST rules?
Which Caribbean territory uses UTC-4 but does not observe DST and thus differs seasonally from nearby US regions?
Which historical figure promoted Greenwich as the prime meridian through naval influence?
Which measurement defines the SI second using a cesium-133 atomic transition frequency?
Which country set its time zone to UTC+8 in 1949 but saw local unofficial times remain in use for years?
Which municipality uniquely observes a different time zone than its surrounding region for commerce reasons in the U.S.?
options: Phenix City, Alabama (aligning with Columbus, GA)
hard.answer: Phenix City, Alabama (aligning with Columbus, GA)

hard.question: Which scientific service publishes leap second announcements months in advance?
Which country's legal time was advanced by 30 minutes in 1982 to reduce power usage during peak hours?
Which timekeeping system did railroads in 19th-century North America adopt before national standardization?
Which island in the Pacific uses UTC-9:30 as its standard time?
Which country maintains unique legal definitions for time in different regions leading to multiple 'official' times?
Which technology's adoption in the 19th century most required synchronized time across cities?
Which historical convention set the day starting at midnight worldwide for civil purposes?
options: Adoption by national civil codes in late 19th century
hard.answer: Adoption by national civil codes in late 19th century

hard.question: Which country uses a non-integer time zone offset of UTC+3:30?
Which airline/time-industry standard uses the letter 'Z' to denote UTC?
Which major capital officially changed time zone in 1919 to support postwar commerce?
Which global navigation satellite system provides precise time synchronization crucial for UTC realization?
Which country altered its date line position internally in the 19th century, causing local calendar inconsistencies?
Which legal instrument in the UK originally defined Greenwich Mean Time as the legal time of Great Britain?
options: Standard Time Act (1880s precedents) leading to later acts
hard.answer: Standard Time Act (1880s precedents) leading to later acts

hard.question: Which European microstate aligns its legal time with a neighboring country rather than its longitude?
Which scientific observation links irregularities in Earth's rotation to leap second decisions?
options: Variations in length of day measured by VLBI
hard.answer: Variations in length of day measured by VLBI
